name: Hard Villains in Classic Movies Quiz / Test | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Some villains play the role as a typical "snidely whiplash" leering character - such as the villain (Trampas)in "The Virginian". Who played the role?
questions.explanation:
Brian Donlevy.

	Scott is the villain in "The Hustler". Bogart has often played hoodlum types. Duryea also is frequently the outlaw or villain.

questions.text: Some actors have made a profession out of playing villains. One such actor plays the "heavy" in "The Greatest Show on Earth" (starring Charlton Heston). Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Lyle Bettger.

	Bettger is always a villain - period. The same is true for Gordon. None of these four are household names - but you'd know them if you saw them.

questions.text: Some actors are versatile enough to be convincing as heroes or villains. Eli Wallach was great as the villain in "The Magnificent Seven". What happens to him in the movie?
options: He flees from the seven and from the town
questions.explanation:
He dies.

	Wallach is good in just about everything he does - and he's fine as the leader of the raiding outlaws in "Seven".

questions.text: Another classic villain is Lee Van Cleef. Which movie includes him as one of the "bad guys"?
questions.explanation:
High Noon.

	He's one of the men waiting for the train - and waiting to get Gary Cooper.

questions.text: Villains are sometimes suave and urbane. James Mason played such a villain in "North by Northwest" - and in what other movie?
questions.explanation:
Prisoner of Zenda.

	Mason is excellent as Rupert of Hentzau. Ray Milland is equally urbane in "Dial M"; the same is true of George Sanders in "Ivanhoe". George C. Scott is similarly low-key in "Hustler".

questions.text: Villains often come in bunches: for example, Robert Ryan, Lee Marvin and Ernest Borgnine teamed up to play "heavies" in one movie. Who played the "good guy" in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Spencer Tracy.

	The movie is "Bad Day at Black Rock". The other three are all legendary "tough guys".

questions.text: Alan Ladd faced a classic villain in "Shane". Which one?
questions.explanation:
Jack Palance.

	Palance is fine as a cocky, smirking gunman. Sanders is a suave villain in "Ivanhoe". Cobb is a gruff bad guy in "On The Waterfront". Boyd, of course, is the villain in "Ben-Hur".

questions.text: Sometimes, the villain isn't known until the end of the movie - as in "Laura". Who plays the villain?
questions.explanation:
Clifton Webb.

	They're all in the movie, but Webb is the killer. Price is innocent, Andrews is the investigating cop, and Tierney is Laura.

questions.text: A typical type of villain is the "mad scientist". Who played the role in "Superman"?
questions.explanation:
Gene Hackman.

	Lex Luthor, himself. Price has probably played that type of role a thousand times.

questions.text: Laurence Olivier, one of the best actors, often played the villain. In which of these movies did he NOT play a "bad guy" - or a man confronting ultimate evil?
questions.explanation:
Wuthering Heights.

	A great job in "Spartacus".
